title: Ctrl+F1 Functionality Limited to Specific Fields in Help Search
description: The Ctrl+F1 shortcut doesn't work as expected in certain fields of the Help Search window.
OB: When using Eclipse with a DBCS locale, attempting to invoke the help screen by pressing Ctrl+F1 specifically on the first text field in the Help Search window yields no response.
EB:
OS: LinuxGTKBuild: RC2 with IBMJava2131 JRE

Expected Behavior:
Upon pressing Ctrl+F1 in the first text field of the Help Search window, a help pop-up screen should appear, displaying relevant information about the Help Search.
SR:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch Eclipse with a DBCS locale.
2. From the menu bar, select 'Search' > 'Help'.
3. In the resulting window, click on the first text field.
4. Press Ctrl+F1.

Observation:
- No response occurs; the help pop-up screen does not appear.

Comments:
1. This issue is consistent across all DBCS languages.
2. The problem is isolated to the first text field; other fields in the window function correctly with Ctrl+F1.
3. See the attached image for a clear indication of the problematic field (circled in red); fields that respond properly are highlighted in green.
